transcript.title: STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, THE HON P J KEATING MP
transcript.content:
QKi-PRIME MINISTER 16/ 92
STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, THE HON P J KEATING, MP
The Commonwealth Government's offer to fund half the costs
of a feasibility study for the Bell Bay Steel Mill stands.
There has never been any doubt about the willingness of the
Commonwealth to allocate $ 500,000 to fund the study.
It is uncertain whether Premier elect Groom is committed to
the project. As late as this morning, in the Launceston
Examiner, it was unclear whether Mr Groom was committed to
State Government funding.
Mr Groom should make it clear that his Government is
committed to funding the study and put the interests of
Tasmania ahead of attempts at political point scoring.
All Mr Groom has to do is to indicate his unequivocal
commitment to his Government funding its share of the study.
13 FEBRUARY J. 992
